register.description: This register contains the IP revision code. IP revision code is defined at design time

bitfield.description: Read returns 0.
IP revision code[7:4]Major revision[3:0]Minor revisionExamples: 0x10 for 1.0, 0x21 for 2.1

register.description: This register controls the various parameters of the Interconnect.

bitfield.description: Write 0s for future compatibility. Read returns 0s.
Write 0s for future compatibility. Read returns 0s.
Write 0s for future compatibility. Read returns 0s.
Power management Req/Ack Control

bitenum.description: Force Idle - An idle request is acknowledged unconditionally
No Idle - An idle request is never acknowledged.
Smart Idle - Acknowledgment to an idle request is based on the internal activity of the module

bitfield.description: Write 0s for future compatibility. Read returns 0.
Software reset
Internal interface clock gating strategy

bitenum.description: Automatic interface clock gating strategy is applied, based on the interconnect activity

register.description: This register provides module status, excluding interrupt status info.

bitfield.description: Reserved for module-specific status information.Read returns 0s.
Reserved for interconnect socket status information.Read returns 0s.
Internal reset monitoring

bitenum.description: Reset complete. The module is ready to be used.

register.description: Request information permission

bitfield.description: Request information permissionThe REQINFO field is a bit vector of permissions, one per MReqInfo encoding: NonHost/Host - User/Supervisor - Functional/Debug - Data Transfer/Opcode Fetch

register.description: This register provides the list of all initiators that have permission for reading from that memory region.

bitfield.description: Write 0s for future compatibility. Read returns 0s.
One bit per initiator group. Bit 0 set to 1 means that initiator whose ConnID = 0 has read permission to the protected region i.

register.description: This register provides the region #j start address (lowest address inside the region), with a 64-KB granularity.

bitfield.description: Write 0s for future compatibility. Read returns 0.
Region #j start address (included in the region)Aligned on 64-KB boundary. [15:0] must be written with 0s. No STARTADDRESS parameter for region 0.
Write 0s for future compatibility. Read returns 0.

register.description: This register provides the region #j end address (lowest address outside the region), with a 64-KB granularity.

bitfield.description: Write 0s for future compatibility. Read returns 0s.

register.description: This register controls the arbitration parameters between the class 0 request groups.

bitfield.description: Delayed service until burst request complete BurstComplete[k], k= 6 to 7 (BURST-COMPLETE[30] is for group number 6, BURST-COMPLETE[31] is for group number 7)

bitenum.description: Group #k request to arbiter issued as soon as the first burst request is available
Group #k request to arbiter delayed until a complete burst transaction is buffered

bitfield.description: Write 0s for future compatibility. Read returns 0s.

Extended grant service inside a classVector specifying the number of consecutive services a group is granted. 2 bits per group ExtendedGrant[2*k+1,2*k], k = 6 to 7 (EXTENDEDGRANT[21:20] is for group number 6, EXTENDEDGRANT[23:22] is for group number 7)
Write 0s for future compatibility. Read returns 0s.

High-priority attribute inside a classVector allocating a higher priority to one of the class members. A single group may be given this attribute at a time. HighPrioVector[k], k= 6 to 7 (HIGHPRIOVECTOR[6] is for group number 6, HIGHPRIOVECTOR[7] is for group number 7)

bitenum.description: Group #k has the highest priority over all other class members.

bitfield.description: Write 0s for future compatibility. Read returns 0s.

register.description: This register controls the arbitration parameters between the class 1 request groups.

bitfield.description: Write 0s for future compatibility. Read returns 0s.
Delayed service until burst request completeBurstComplete[k], k= 0 to 1 (BURST-COMPLETE[24] is for group number 0, BURST-COMPLETE[25] is for group number 1)

bitenum.description: Group #k request to arbiter issued as soon as the first burst request is available
Group #k request to arbiter delayed until a complete burst transaction is buffered

bitfield.description: Write 0s for future compatibility. Read returns 0s.

Extended grant service inside a classVector specifying the number of consecutive services a group is granted. 2 bits per group ExtendedGrant[2*k+1,2*k], k = 0 to 1 (EXTENDEDGRANT[9:8] is for group number 0, EXTENDEDGRANT[11:10] is for group number 1)
Write 0s for future compatibility. Read returns 0s.

High-priority attribute inside a classVector allocating a higher priority to one of the class members. A single group may be given this attribute at a time. HighPrioVector[k], k= 0 to 1 (HIGHPRIOVECTOR[1] is for group number 1, HIGHPRIOVECTOR[0] is for group number 0)

bitenum.description: Group #k has the highest priority over all other class members.

register.description: This register controls the arbitration parameters between the class 2 request groups.

bitfield.description: Write 0s for future compatibility. Read returns 0s.

Delayed service until burst request completeBurstComplete[k], k= 2 to 5 (BURST-COMPLETE[29] is for group number 5, BURST-COMPLETE[28] is for group number 4, BURST-COMPLETE[27] is for group number 3, BURST-COMPLETE[26] is for group number 2)

bitenum.description: Group #k request to arbiter issued as soon as the first burst request is available
Group #k request to arbiter delayed until a complete burst transaction is buffered

bitfield.description: Write 0s for future compatibility. Read returns 0s.

Vector specifying the number of consecutive services a group is granted. 2 bits per group ExtendedGrant[2*k+1,2*k], k = 2 to 5 (EXTENDEDGRANT[19:18] is for group number 5, EXTENDEDGRANT[17:16] is for group number 4, EXTENDEDGRANT[15:14] is for group number 3, EXTENDEDGRANT[13:12] is for group number 2)
Write 0s for future compatibility. Read returns 0s.

Vector allocating a higher priority to one of the class members. A single group may be given this attribute at a time. HighPrioVector[k], k= 2 to 5 (HIGHPRIOVECTOR[5] is for group number 5, HIGHPRIOVECTOR[4] is for group number 4, HIGHPRIOVECTOR[3] is for group number 3, HIGHPRIOVECTOR[2] is for group number 2)

bitenum.description: Group #k has the highest priority over all other class members.

bitfield.description: Write 0s for future compatibility. Read returns 0s.

register.description: This register controls the PWM counter that defines the priority alternation between class 1 and class 2.

bitfield.description: Write 0s for future compatibility. Read returns 0s.
Class 2 high-priority window width (clock cycle count). Do not set to 0x00.
Write 0s for future compatibility. Read returns 0s.
Class 1 high-priority window width (clock cycle count). Do not set to 0x00.

register.description: This register controls the number of consecutive services that is allocated to a thread whose transactions have been split by the rotation engine.

bitfield.description: Write 0s for future compatibility. Read returns 0s.
Number of RE split transactions serviced consecutively when the thread gets granted by the arbitration logic.

register.description: This register controls the number of consecutive services that is allocated to a thread whose transactions have been split by the rotation engine.

bitfield.description: Write 0s for future compatibility. Read returns 0s.
Number of RE split transactions serviced consecutively when the thread gets granted by the arbitration logic.

register.description: This register controls the number of consecutive services that is allocated to a thread whose transactions have been split by the rotation engine.

bitfield.description: Write 0s for future compatibility. Read returns 0s.
Number of RE split transactions serviced consecutively when the thread gets granted by the arbitration logic.

register.description: This register captures the address of an access that has generated an error.

bitfield.description: Access address that has generated an error (bit 31 is always 0)

register.description: This register provides additional information about the access that has generated the error.

bitfield.description: Write 0s for future compatibility. Read returns 0s.
ID of the region that has been illegally accessed0x0: Region 00x1: Region 1...0x7: Region 70x8 to 0xF: reserved
Write 0s for future compatibility. Read returns 0s.
Interconnect command that caused the error
Identifies the illegal access initiator interconnect ConnID of the illegal access initiator.Refer to the top level documentation of the device using the SMS module
Write 0s for future compatibility.Read returns 0s.
Request targeting non-defined rotation contexts (such as contexts 12, 13, 14, or 15) or non-defined L3 Interconnect request signals used for context number decoding.

bitenum.description: A request has been received on the interconnect with address decoding targeting rotation contexts 12, 13, 14, or 15, or a signal used for context number decoding was undefined.

bitfield.description: Unexpected request received during SMS idle state

bitenum.description: A request has been received on the interconnect after the SMS was put in idle mode by the system power manager.

bitfield.description: Illegal command on the L3 interface
Write 0s for future compatibility.Read returns 0s.
Protection region overlapping error

bitenum.description: A protection region overlap violation has been detected.

bitfield.description: Reserved for non-GP devices.
Reserved for non-GP devices.
Error validity status - Must be explicitly cleared with a write transaction

bitenum.description: All error fields no longer valid
Error detected and logged in the other error fields

register.description: This register controls the SMS power management in conjunction with the regular interconnect socket registers.

bitfield.description: Write 0s for future compatibility. Read returns 0s.
Delay (expressed in L3 clock cycle units) before autoidle, that is, before disabling the SMS functional clock when no more traffic in the SMS module.

register.description: This register configures the virtual rotated frame buffer module for context #n.

bitfield.description: Write 0s for future compatibility. Read returns 0s.
Exponent based 2 value, 2 indicates the page height in bytes for context #n.
Write 0s for future compatibility. Read returns 0s.
Exponent based 2 value, 2 indicates the page width in bytes for context #n.
Write 0s for future compatibility. Read returns 0s.
Exponent based 2 value, 2 indicates the pixel size in bytes for context #n. A value of 3 is invalid.

bitfield.description: Write 0s for future compatibility. Read returns 0s.
